properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 1 at 11:06PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
At 1106 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over
Jasper, or 8 miles north of Carthage, moving northeast at 15 mph.

Penny size hail and wind gusts up to 50 mph will be possible with
this storm.

Locations impacted include...
Carl Junction...                  Oronogo...
Jasper...                         Golden City...
Alba...                           Purcell...
Nashville...                      Carytown...
Asbury...                         Neck City...
Waco...                           Dudenville...
Kenoma...                         Boston...

This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 48 and 64.
properties.instruction:
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SOUTHERN BARTON AND NORTHERN JASPER COUNTIES UNTIL 1145 PM CST
